histogram.name: SensitiveContent.SensitiveTabSwitchingAnimations
histogram.summary: Records how many times each tab switching animation is marked as sensitive. Emitted every time a tab switching animation occurs and is marked as sensitive. A tab switching animation is marked as sensitive if it offers a preview of a sensitive tab. Each bucket of this histogram represents one type of tab switching animation.

histogram.name: SensitiveContent.TabSwitching.{TabSwitchingSurface}.Sensitivity
histogram.summary: Records whether the {TabSwitchingSurface} is sensitive. The {TabSwitchingSurface} is sensitive if at least one of the tabs is sensitive at the moment when the {TabSwitchingSurface} is opened. Emitted every time the {TabSwitchingSurface} is opened. The {TabSwitchingSurface} has the same content sensitivity from the moment it is opened until the moment it is closed. Only recorded on Chrome for Android.

histogram.name: SensitiveContent.{Embedder}.LatencyUntilSensitive
histogram.summary: Records the latency between the moment when a sensitive form appears in the DOM (or from the moment the form becomes sensitive, if initially not sensitive) and the moment when the content is marked as sensitive, in {Embedder}. This metric is emitted only when the content sensitivity changes from not sensitive to sensitive.

histogram.name: SensitiveContent.{Embedder}.SensitiveTime
histogram.summary: Records for how long the content was marked as sensitive, in {Embedder}. That is, it measures the time elapsed between when the content was last marked as sensitive until the content was last marked as not sensitive. This metric is emitted every time the content sensitivity of a WebContents changes from sensitive to not sensitive.

histogram.name: SensitiveContent.{Embedder}.SensitivityChanged
histogram.summary: Emitted when the content changed its sensitivity from sensitive to not sensitive and vice-versa, in {Embedder}. On page load, the content is considered not sensitive. This metric gets recorded every time the content sensitivity of a WebContents changes.
